FC - S - Roofing
Pre-installation checks
Substrate acceptable (clean, dry and stable). Edge protection and safety installed. Perimeter support installed if metal deck substrate.
Metcom7
Falls deemed acceptable by Council
Purlins and roof structure ready for Metcom 7 and approval given to lay
Fix steel to manufacturers specifications in compliance with NZBC
The metal profile installed upside down and the specified fastenings installed in the trough
Flashings installed on hips and valleys
Insulation protected from crushing (edge of gutter, timber edging, etc.)
The timber height is exact height of the insulation and the outside edge of the timber has a generous radius to ensure maximum bond of the membrane when dressed over it
Outlets framed and plywood routed out
Metcom7 installed as per spec and completed. Any general observations made
Polyiso
All Polyiso sheets butt jointed - no gaps created
Polyiso Sheets glued down with Viking FAST Adhesive (STP900B) using a proprietary dual cartridge caulking gun
STP900B adhesive applied in sweeping ribbons on every steel rib and then left to ‘foam-up’ over the next few minutes
Polyiso boards laid in a brick-bond pattern.
Butt the polyiso sheets up to the pre-formed timber edging where applicable
Entire roof inspected upon completion to ensure a uniform flat surface
Polyiso installed as per spec and completed. Any general observations made
Membrane
Polyiso thoroughly cleaned and checked prior to priming or membrane application
Checked to ensure no dye-batch colour variation
Ensure the specified membrane thickness and colour is used on site
All products installed with a Viking Membrane comply with Viking Specifications e.g. the tested ‘system’ - Drains and accessories supplied by Viking Roofspec
All welded seams and proprietary items to to be seam probed.
Membrane installed as per spec and completed. Any general observations made
